autolike_description.message: Press the Like button at the same time as downloading

mode_description1.message: No matter which one you choose, the downloaded file is the same and usually you don't need to change from mode1

mode_description2.message: Use mode2 or mode3 when there is a conflict with other addons and the file name or destination folder is no longer changed

mode_description3.message: mode3 is currently unavailable due to Chrome specifications

mode1_description.message: It doesn't do anything strange in the traditional way

mode2_description.message: Avoid conflicts with other download add-ons, but conflicting add-ons will now give error messages.

mode3_description.message: It avoids conflicts with other download add-ons and does not generate the error that occurs in mode2, but the operation may not be stable.

filename_setting.message: Filename setting (can be set by format)

filename_setting_description1.message: Set the file name when saving

format_username.message: Name of the user who posted the video

format_like.message: Number of Likes at save on Iwara.tv

format_view.message: Number of views at save time on Iwara.tv

format_saved_year.message: Year at the time of saving (AD)

format_saved_month.message: Month at the time of saving (01~12)

format_saved_day.message: Date at the time of saving (01~31)

format_saved_hour.message: Time at the time of saving (time:00~23)

format_saved_minute.message: Time at the time of saving (minutes:00~59)

save_location.message: Setting the save destination folder (can be set by formatting)

savelocation_description1.message: You can set the path after the download folder set in Chrome

savelocation_description2.message: The download folder set in Chrome is the value of "Save in" that can be confirmed by opening "chrome://settings/downloads" in the browser.

savelocation_description3.message: For example, if the "save destination" is "P:\iwara" and the set path is "iwarasourcedownloader/?username?/", The save location is "P:\iwara\iwarasourcedownloader\?username?\filename.mp4"

savelocation_description4.message: Use half-width slash "/" as the delimiter between folders

savelocation_description5.message: Backward reference "../" and current reference "./" cannot be used
